channel.title: JS: Inner object access
channel.description:
[code]
Unique Name 1
Unique Name 2
.....
Unique Name 50
[/code] So it's the "this.getElementById('name').innerHTML" that isn't working, even though the concept is right. I'm trying to send the inner html of the span enclosed in the div clicked to a second part of the script. this.getElementById('name').innerHTML

item.title: JS: Inner object access
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Just learn jQuery. It’ll only take about an hour, and all your JavaScript problems will be solved for the rest of your life.

item.title: JS: Inner object access
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Why don’t you just add the onclick value to the span tag?

Read full topic

item.title: JS: Inner object access
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

<div onclick="javascript:clickItem(this.getElementById('name').innerHTML);">
  <span id="name">Unique Name 1</span>
</div>
<div onclick="javascript:clickItem(this.getElementById('name').innerHTML);">
  <span id="name">Unique Name 2</span>
</div>
.....
<div onclick="javascript:clickItem(this.getElementById('name').innerHTML);">
  <span id="name">Unique Name 50</span>
</div>

So it’s the “this.getElementById(‘name’).innerHTML” that isn’t working, even though the concept is right. I’m trying to send the inner html of the span enclosed in the div clicked to a second part of the script.
this.getElementById(‘name’).innerHTML

Read full topic
